intro: Psoralidium linearifolium var. texense, commonly known as the Texas linearifolium psoralidium, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its morphology includes a low-growing habit with hairy stems and narrow, elongated foliage. Botanically, it is part of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is notable for its unique floral structure and ecological niche.
